newsitem.title: UK: U.S. stocks mixed in London, but Wall St seen down.
newsitem.headline: U.S. stocks mixed in London, but Wall St seen down.

text.p: U.S. stocks were mixed in London on Tuesday, but brokers here were expecting Wall Street to ease on profit-taking.
"The market is looking a bit tired," said one broker.
However, the market could be influenced by Digital Equipment's results for its second fiscal quarter, due before Wall Street opens.

Technology shares were mixed, with Digital up $1/4 in London to $34-5/8. Shares in Microsoft Corp rose $3/4 to $134-3/4, buoyed by better-than-expected third quarter results, released after New York markets closed yesterday.
Microsoft, the world's biggest computer software maker, said it earned a record $0.95 per share in the latest quarter.
Shares in International Business Machines, which released its results during market hours yesterday, fell on profit-taking in London, brokers said. The shares were quoted at $129-3/4, down $1/4.

In other trading, shares in General Motors slipped $1/4 to $$53-5/8, despite a report in the Wall Street Journal that the car maker is close to an agreement with Canadian car workers that would end a 19-day strike.
Philip Morris shares dipped $1/4 to $93-1/4 on profit-taking after a $1-1/4-gain in New York yesterday.
Elsewhere, the December S&P 500 futures contract was down 0.90 point to 713.55 on Globex at 1052 GMT. The December 30-year Treasury bond futures contract was flat at 111-2/32.
